pageContext.claim: “Nothing has happened [after U.S. forces left the Syria-Turkey border].”
pageContext.analysis: Without the presence of U.S. troops, Russia has been on the move. Bombing by the Russian air force tipped the scales against the Turkish military in their confrontation over the Idlib province of northern Syria. Since December, 900,000 civilians have been forced to flee Syrian and Russian bombs in the northwest. The United Nations' human rights chief, Michelle Bachelet, called the humanitarian catastrophe unfolding in Syria "cruel beyond belief."
